canvasapi.eli5: The Canvas API is like a digital art board where websites can draw pictures and animations.
canvasapi.boss: The Canvas API lets websites render graphics, charts, and games directly in the browser using JavaScript.
canvasapi.sysadmin: Canvas API provides a 2D rendering context on a <canvas> HTML element, enabling pixel-level drawing and animations via JavaScript.
canvasapi.use_case: Used by game devs to render dynamic scenes in browser-based games.

webgl.eli5: WebGL turns your browser into a tiny video game engine that can show 3D graphics.
webgl.boss: WebGL is a web standard for rendering interactive 2D and 3D graphics without needing plugins.
webgl.sysadmin: WebGL is a JavaScript API that interfaces with the GPU to render 3D graphics using OpenGL ES in web browsers.
webgl.use_case: Used to render 3D models in a browser-based CAD viewer.

svg.eli5: SVG is like drawing with lines and shapes that stay sharp no matter how much you zoom in.
svg.boss: SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) is a format for rendering crisp, resolution-independent images on the web.
svg.sysadmin: SVG uses XML markup to define vector shapes (like paths and circles), making it ideal for logos, icons, and animations.
svg.use_case: Used to create animated web icons that scale perfectly on all devices.
